paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for BRCA2, including penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The mutation c.125A>G (p.Tyr42Cys) was identified in a patient diagnosed with breast cancer at the age of 39, whose mother and two aunts also presented the neoplasia.

functional_data.summary: Classified as a variant of uncertain significance.

variants.segregation_data: Found in a family with a history of breast cancer.
variants.additional_notes: This variant has been reported in the Mexican population.
key_quotes: The mutation c.125A>G (p.Tyr42Cys) was identified in a patient diagnosed with breast cancer at the age of 39.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The most prevalent mutation was c.865A>G, found in six (10.3%) of the families analyzed, in five of them, the age of diagnosis of index cases was between 41 and 51 years.

functional_data.summary: Classified as a variant of uncertain significance.

variants.segregation_data: Found in multiple families with breast cancer.
variants.additional_notes: This is the first report in South America.
key_quotes: The most prevalent mutation was c.865A>G, found in six (10.3%) of the families analyzed.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: A new mutation not previously described was found in the BRCA2 gene, that is, the transition c.6427T>C that generates a serine to proline change (p.Ser2143Pro), this variant was found in a family with two cases of breast cancer and one case of prostate cancer.

functional_data.summary: Classified as a variant of uncertain significance.

variants.segregation_data: Found in a family with breast cancer and prostate cancer.
variants.additional_notes: This variant has not been reported in the BIC databases.
key_quotes: A new mutation not previously described was found in the BRCA2 gene, that is, the transition c.6427T>C.

tables_processed.table_caption: BRCA1 and BRCA2 germline mutations detected in Colombian pacific high-risk breast/ovarian cancer families

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text and tables.
